variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: shared
variants.description: install shared libraries if True, static if false

dependencies.name: bison
dependencies.description:
Bison is a general-purpose parser generator that converts an annotated
context-free grammar into a deterministic LR or generalized LR (GLR)
parser employing LALR(1) parser tables.

dependencies.name: diffutils
dependencies.description:
GNU Diffutils is a package of several programs related to finding
differences between files.

dependencies.name: findutils
dependencies.description:
The GNU Find Utilities are the basic directory searching utilities of
the GNU operating system.

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: gnuconfig
dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.

dependencies.name: openssl
dependencies.description:
OpenSSL is an open source project that provides a robust, commercial-
grade, and full-featured toolkit for the Transport Layer Security (TLS)
and Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) protocols. It is also a general-purpose
cryptography library.

dependencies.name: perl
dependencies.description:
Perl 5 is a highly capable, feature-rich programming language with over
27 years of development.

dependencies.name: pkgconfig
dependencies.description:
pkgconf is a program which helps to configure compiler and linker flags
for development frameworks. It is similar to pkg-config from
freedesktop.org, providing additional functionality while also
maintaining compatibility.

dependent_to.name: mariadb
dependent_to.description:
MariaDB Server is one of the most popular database servers in the world.
MariaDB turns data into structured information in a wide array of
applications, ranging from banking to websites. It is an enhanced, drop-
in replacement for MySQL. MariaDB is used because it is fast, scalable
and robust, with a rich ecosystem of storage engines, plugins and many
other tools make it very versatile for a wide variety of use cases.

dependent_to.name: nfs-ganesha
dependent_to.description:
NFS-Ganesha is an NFSv3,v4,v4.1 fileserver that runs in user mode on
most UNIX/Linux systems. It also supports the 9p.2000L protocol.

dependent_to.name: py-gssapi
dependent_to.description:
Python-GSSAPI provides both low-level and high level wrappers around the
GSSAPI C libraries.

dependent_to.name: wireshark
dependent_to.description: Graphical network analyzer and capture tool

dependent_to.name: redland-bindings
dependent_to.description: Redland Language Bindings for language APIs to Redland

dependent_to.name: curl
dependent_to.description:
cURL is an open source command line tool and library for transferring
data with URL syntax

dependent_to.name: libtirpc
dependent_to.description: Libtirpc is a port of Suns Transport-Independent RPC library to Linux.

dependent_to.name: xrootd
dependent_to.description:
The XROOTD project aims at giving high performance, scalable fault
tolerant access to data repositories of many kinds.

dependent_to.name: mariadb-c-client
dependent_to.description:
MariaDB turns data into structured information in a wide array of
applications, ranging from banking to websites. It is an enhanced, drop-
in replacement for MySQL. MariaDB is used because it is fast, scalable
and robust, with a rich ecosystem of storage engines, plugins and many
other tools make it very versatile for a wide variety of use cases. This
package comprises only the standalone 'C Connector', which enables
connections to MariaDB and MySQL servers.

dependent_to.name: ghostscript
dependent_to.description: An interpreter for the PostScript language and for PDF.

dependent_to.name: py-kerberos
dependent_to.description:
This Python package is a high-level wrapper for Kerberos (GSSAPI)
operations. The goal is to avoid having to build a module that wraps the
entire Kerberos.framework, and instead offer a limited set of functions
that do what is needed for client/server Kerberos authentication based
on <https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc4559.txt>.

dependent_to.name: openssh
dependent_to.description:
OpenSSH is the premier connectivity tool for remote login with the SSH
protocol. It encrypts all traffic to eliminate eavesdropping, connection
hijacking, and other attacks. In addition, OpenSSH provides a large
suite of secure tunneling capabilities, several authentication methods,
and sophisticated configuration options.

dependent_to.name: py-pykerberos
dependent_to.description:
This Python package is a high-level wrapper for Kerberos (GSSAPI)
operations.
